linkTarget.anchoringText: Figure 4 demonstrates the data capture and allocation process.

formatted-caption.caption-text: Production Data Management Process for Garraf Field

linkTarget.anchoringText: Figure 6 shows a partial configuration of production network.

image-wrap.label: Figure 6
image-wrap.caption: Partial Illustration of Logical Allocation Network

formatted-caption.caption-text: Partial Illustration of Logical Allocation Network

linkTarget.anchoringText: Figure 7 shows the back allocated volumes in comparison with periodic well test data for a representative well in Garraf Field. Various undcertainties are contributed in the back allocation process, mainly around metering uncertainties, well test volumes as well as estimation of evaporated volumes. Also in prorational back allocation the effect of well head pressures on the other wells sharing same network is usually neglected.

image-wrap.label: Figure 7
image-wrap.caption: Allocated Data and Estimated Production Based on Wells Test

formatted-caption.caption-text: Allocated Data and Estimated Production Based on Wells Test

linkTarget.anchoringText: Also well head ans status parameters have been monitored to understand the status of the well and evaluate if Any optimization will be required. A representative well monitoring parameters is shown in Figure 8.

image-wrap.label: Figure 8
image-wrap.caption: Well Head Parameters for a Representative Well in Garraf Field
